alert.note: Alert for Elmore; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 4:19PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Elmore and northern Montgomery Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 419 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Elmore, or near Wetumpka, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northern Montgomery, Prattville, Millbrook, Wetumpka, Tallassee, Elmore, Coosada, Deatsville, Montgomery Zoo, Boylston, Bob Woodruff Lake, Emerald Mountain, Lagoon Park, Hunter, Eastdale Mall, Blue Ridge, Gunter Air Force Base, Jordan Lake, Wetumpka Municipal Airport and Mitylene. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for south central, southeastern and east central Alabama.
